category.text: $course$/Default for Software Enterprise IV: Process and Project Management

questiontext.text: The authors suggest that distrust may arise during the estimation process between project managers and developers. What do they suggest as root causes for this mistrust? Do you agree with their hypothesis?

feedback.text: the authors suggest that their lack of development expertise is the root cause, and therefore they are more likely to accept estimates they do not understand, and not likely to accept estimates for soft tasks. Do you agree with this? What if the PM is a seasoned developer?

questiontext.text: Consider the steps 1-9 that the author describes in the section "How Do We Use Earned Value?" Even though we haven't covered WBSs yet, consider the steps and discuss whether you believe it is a good idea to use this process, EXACTLY AS PRESENTED, for software development projects.

Explain why it is not sufficient to simply measure how many hours your team is working and compare it against how many hours you expected to work over a given sprint. What extra dimension to measuring the work does Earned Value add?

We have used the "diamond" metaphor for talking about the relationships between the constraints on a software project. For example, one constraint is "TIME", which was fixed for your projects, and another constraint is QUALITY. Answer the following:

  1. List the other 2 corners of the diamond, and give a sentence or two describing what it is and why it is important.
  2. Pick either of the 2 you just described, and discuss how it relates to, and impacts QUALITY. For example, I might say that TIME impacts QUALITY in that if the customer moves the project deadline closer, I may decrease the Quality of the product as I do not have enough time to (you take it from here with another constraint)...
  3. What is in the middle of the diamond? Why is it most central of all?

Step 2 of the Postmortem process is "Cllect objective information". Answer the following:

  1. If you had ONLY ONE PRODUCT-related piece of objective information you could collect for a Postmortem, what would it be and why?
  2. If you had ONLY ONE PROCESS-related piece of objective information you could collect for a Postmortem, what would it be and why?

Step 3 of the Postmortem process is "Conduct a debriefing meeting" and Step 4 is "Have a Project History Day". For each of these steps, indicate WHO participates, and WHAT the primary goal of each step is.

Warning: Long question!!!

Below is a WBS in outline format and a set of dependencies across the WBS. Best, average, and worst case estimates of the amount of time to perform each work package are in parenthesis next to the package.

Answer the following questions (number your answers below!):

On a separate piece of paper, convert the WBS to a PERT chart. The network should include tasks for all work packages (leaf nodes) in the WBS. Use the dependency information provided below. For each node, compute the weighted estimate using our standard PERT formula:
(best case + 4 * expected + worst case) / 6

  1. What are the weighted estimates for npdes 1.1, 2.2, and 3.2.2?
  2. Identify the Critical Path and its duration by using the weighted estimates from the PERT chart. List the critical path in order.
  3. What are the early start time and the last finish time for node 1.2?
  4. Considering just the best, expected, and worst case estimates, which node (other than node 0 or node 4) has the LOWEST RISK and why?
  5. Assume tasks 1.2 and 2.1 may only be performed by a DBA, and you only have one DBA in your organization. How would this impact your answer in part 2?

WBS (best, expected, worst case estimates in days): Dependency information
0. Project Kickoff meeting (1, 1, 1) D0) Task 0 completes before anything else starts
1. Create database schema D1) 1.1 must complete before 1.2 starts
1.1 Create DDL scripts (2, 7, 12) D2) 1.1 must complete before 2.1 starts
1.2 Create DML scripts (3, 4, 5) D3) 1.2 must complete before 2.2 starts
2. Implement data access tier
2.1 Generate Java Value Objects (9, 16, 29)
2.2 Implement DAO objects (12, 15, 24)
3. Implement presentation tier
3.1 Develop Javascript (2, 11, 26) D4) 3.1 must complete before 3.2.1 starts
3.2. Develop markup templates
3.2.1 Develop HTML templates (2, 5, 8) D5) 3.2.1 must complete before 3.2.2 starts
3.2.2 Develop CSS for skins/themes (7, 12, 17)
4. Project wrap-up meeting (1, 1, 1) D6) Task 4 starts after all other tasks end

Microsquash is a brand new software company readying its first software product release for the marketplace. It plans on spending 1 month in Functional/System Test, 1 month in Benchmark Test, and 1 month in Pilot Test. However, Sales & Marketing has decided that the product must go to market in 2 months. As Quality Manager, you must cancel one of the test types to make the schedule. Which choice would you make and why, based on Microsquash' situation?
Select the term that best matches the description

subquestion.text: The creation or insertion of a bug
The phase when a bug is found
The phase when a bug is fixed or otherwise resolved

questiontext.text: Match the estimation method with its description

subquestion.text: A technique where an individual makes an estimate based on a similar software module s/he had previously constructed.
An algorithmic estimation technique where variables representing different project attributes are input and a single value is output.
An Agile method of negotiation where developers and customers work together to agree on estimates and priorities.
Am iterative team-oriented process where successive rounds are meant to help the team converge on an agreed estimate

questiontext.text: Match the estimation problem with a possible cause of that problem

subquestion.text: Overoptimism by software engineers
A fear of reprisal
The project leader is the sole source of the estimate
Deadline-driven estimation

questiontext.text: Match the acronym with the informal definition of the concept it represents.

subquestion.text: This is the costs spent on the project to date
This is the original planned cost of doing the work that has been completed so far
This is how much the work is expected to cost over the lifetime of the project

questiontext.text: Match the test type with the appropriate description

subquestion.text: Tests a module against "ground truth"
You think your product is 100% ready to go
Often has contractual implications
Tests system performance under a heavy load
These tests are done by developers
Tests the interfaces between components

questiontext.text: Experts say there are between ____ and ____ defects injected for every 1000 lines of code
The key factors to effectively using QDM for defect containment include (select ALL that apply):

answer.text: Use past data to analyze current performance

questiontext.text: The author suggests Capture-Recapture be used in conjunction with what kind of defect discovery technique?
Select all of the following which are true regarding assumptions and the estimation process

answer.text: assmuptions add uncertainty to the estimate
incorrect assumptions should cause the schedule and estimates to be revised
a team should hold brainstorming sessions or other techniques to identify as many assumptions as possible
the presence of assumptions means the team has only reached a temporary decision
identifying assumptions can wait until later in the project

questiontext.text: Select all of the following stakeholder types that should participate in the estimation process
Select all of the following which are true about successful estimates

answer.text: they are guaranteed to be accurate
they may vary based on different people's assumptions
good estimates often start with a WBS

questiontext.text: Value is earned on a project when _________ are completed.
What units of measurement are often used for EV?
The author uses Figure 2 to explain several terms. But Figure 2 also paints a picture of a project. Based on Figure 2, the project it depicts is:

answer.text: Not on time but within budget
Not on time and over budget

questiontext.text: The concept of "earned values" was introduced in the __________ and has been in use by the DoD since the _________

According to Boehm, risk assessment is comprised of which of the following steps:
According to Boehm, risk control is comprised of which of the following steps:
According to Boehm, risk management is comprised of which of the following top-level steps:

Suppose on your project you are concerned your customer thinks a user story you omitted from the SRS will be included in the product. You figure the probability of this is 30%, but it would add 50 hours to your team's workload. You could spend 4 hours meeting with the customer, but there is only a 20% chance you will eliminate the risk. What is your risk exposure to 1) the original user story risk? 2) to the risk if you meet with her? 3) Do you meet with her?
Which of the following are predecessor relationships between tasks?
Which of the following are examples of "resources"?
Test automation tools rely on these kinds of techniques to define test interactions:
Testing is complete when any of the following are true:

answer.text: all defects found satisfy an acceptance criteria
after a finite period of time
when qa gets tired of testing it

questiontext.text: The goal of test execution is to

answer.text: make the organization aware of issues encountered during testing

questiontext.text: Which of the following are false statements about software testers?

answer.text: Anyone can be a tester, it involves no skills or training
Testers should work in a different building than programmers

questiontext.text: The quality of a software product is whose responsibility?
A type of test focusing on making sure any changes have not broken existing functionality is called
A subset of test cases representative of the entire test plan is called a _________
The description of a specific interaction with the system to test a single behavior is called the test ______
Suppose the probability of some unfortunate outcome on your project is 20%, and the loss would be defined as 30 hours of extra work time. What is the resulting risk exposure?
According to Humphrey, a Requirements defect that takes one hour to fix in-phase takes ____ hours to fix in the Coding phase
Defects found during testing reveal as much about the adequacy _____ (1 word) as they do the quality of the product.
Estimates are a highly _____ process
Many companies do not want to share their postmortem because they worry they will end up in _______, explaining to a judge and jury explaining their failures.
The main purpose of Project History Day is to determine the _____ ________ of project issues so process improvement activities can address them.
Successful project managers are
One possible way to address the problem of accurately estimating P(UO) and L(UO) is to use values on a ____________ of 0 to 10.
The initial schedule against which changes should be measured is called the _________________
Extra "empty" tasks added to a schedule are called _____________
The sequence of tasks that comprises the minimum time to complete the project is called the
When a task involves an activity, resource, or work product that is also subsequently required by another task, then it has a _____ on that other task.
The most common type of scheduling chart is the ______________ chart
The amount of time a task in a sequence can be delayed without delaying the last task in the sequence is called the _____________
Your textbook defines quality as ____________
the process of reviewing a defect in the defect tracking system and assigning it a priority for repair is called ______________
Defect removal times should trend by phase differently than defect injection rates per phase
Earned Values are a measure of project effort

feedback.text: Correct, it is not a measure of effort but a measure of progress

questiontext.text: Earned Value refers to a methodology
Debriefing meetings that allow team members to vent project frustrations are always bad.
A postmortem is a cataloging and understanding of your successes
It is important to publish results only to management so they know who to blame (and whom to possibly fire).
Some of the survey questions used on different projects should be the same so you can compare answers and look for commonalities.
A significant issue with the Risk Exposure calculation is the ability to accurately estimate what P(UO) and L(UO) values are.
Defining automated tests takes more effort than manual testing.
Executing automated tests takes more effort than manual testing.
The tester is responsible for determining the impact of a defect on the organization's business value.

name.text: TESTING: test case vs. use case

questiontext.text: A test case is like a use case in that both of them detail the exact sequence of user interface actions (pressing buttons, hotkeys, drag-n-drop, etc.) needed to exercise system functionality.
Testers are only responsible for reporting what they see when they use the software
